body: Hi @ashwinbaliga, thanks for the issue. I could reproduce what you described, but I'm unsure if this is intended behaviour or a bug. I'll push it forward for the team to check out.

issue.title: Bug: Duplicate problems in the playground are not removed when the code changes
issue.body:
### URL(s)

https://eslint.org/play/#

### What did you do?

While looking into [this issue](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/17244#issuecomment-1579870712) in the main repo, I opened the repro URL specified above, then I started adding empty lines at the top of the code editor in the playground.

### What did you expect to happen?

The list of problems in the lower part of the page should stay the same, except for the line numbers.

### What actually happened?

Duplicate problems are not removed when the code is changed, and you end up with the list getting longer and longer every time a new empty line is added, with new problems getting listed after the old ones.


### Participation

- [X] I am willing to submit a pull request for this issue.

### Additional comments

_No response_

body: There are no [unit tests](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/v8.42.0/tests/lib/rules/block-scoped-var.js) with more problems reported than variable usages for this rule, so it seems that the current behavior was not intended/predicted. I think it's a bug.

> Error 3:11 'myvar' used outside of binding context. ([block-scoped-var](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var))
> 
> Error 3:11 'myvar' used outside of binding context. ([block-scoped-var](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var))
> 
> Error 3:11 'myvar' used outside of binding context. ([block-scoped-var](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var))

I think this is correct behavior. The first error is for the declaration on line 5, the second is for the declaration on line 7, and the third is for the declaration on line 9. Perhaps we could add the declaration's loc to the error message to make it clear what is reported.

Alternatively, we could update the rule to not report init references, but after that change this rule would produce zero errors in the above example, not one for each line. According to the test cases, reporting init references is intentional:

https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/030a82737f51563f9a7b4985fc91b6d8eab54fce/tests/lib/rules/block-scoped-var.js#L163-L176

> I think this is correct behavior. The first error is for the declaration on line 5, the second is for the declaration on line 7, and the third is for the declaration on line 9. Perhaps we could add the declaration's loc to the error message to make it clear what is reported.

Wouldn't it be possible to report one single problem for all declarations? E.g.:

Error 3:11 'myvar' used outside of binding context. Declarations on lines 5, 7 and 9. ([block-scoped-var](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var))

> > I think this is correct behavior. The first error is for the declaration on line 5, the second is for the declaration on line 7, and the third is for the declaration on line 9. Perhaps we could add the declaration's loc to the error message to make it clear what is reported.
> 
> Wouldn't it be possible to report one single problem for all declarations? E.g.:
> 
> Error 3:11 'myvar' used outside of binding context. Declarations on lines 5, 7 and 9. ([block-scoped-var](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var))

That's doable, but seems too complex for addressing this edge case, while it still can be argued that reporting multiple errors is the correct behavior.

I'd suggest we just add the location info to the error message, so that it looks like this (similar to no-shadow messages):

> Error 3:11 'myvar' declared on line 5 column 11 is used outside of binding context. ([block-scoped-var](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var))
> 
> Error 3:11 'myvar' declared on line 7 column 11 is used outside of binding context. ([block-scoped-var](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var))
> 
> Error 3:11 'myvar' declared on line 9 column 11 is used outside of binding context. ([block-scoped-var](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var))
Looks like there's agreement on https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/17244#issuecomment-1580232223. I'm working on this.

issue.title: feat: add declaration loc to message in block-scoped-var

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[ ] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[x] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

Fixes https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/17244

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

In the `block-scoped-var` rule, I added the location info of declarations to reported messages. This should clarify cases where there are multiple errors on the same reference, and seems useful in general.

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->
